translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fifth Section
The Discussion of the Knowledge of One Beyond Training
Is there knowledge of one beyond training in one who is still in training?
“Yes.”

original: Sekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāti passati, diṭṭhaṁ viditaṁ sacchikataṁ upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: sekhaḥ asekham dhammam jānāti passati diṭṭham viditam sacchikatam upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Does one who is still in training know and see the Dhamma of one beyond training, having known and seen it, does he enter and dwell in it, having touched it with his body?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: nanu sekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ na jānāti na passati, adiṭṭhaṁ aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ na upasampajja viharati, na kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: nanu sekhaḥ asekham dhammam na jānāti na passati adiṭṭham aviditam asacchikatam na upasampajja viharati na kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Then is it that one who is still in training does not know and see the Dhamma of one beyond training, not having known and seen it, he does not enter and dwell in it, not having touched it with his body?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci sekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ na jānāti na passati, adiṭṭhaṁ aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ na upasampajja viharati, na kāyena phusitvā viharati, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sekhaḥ asekham dhammam na jānāti na passati adiṭṭham aviditam asacchikatam na upasampajja viharati na kāyena phusitvā viharati no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Then, if one who is still in training does not know and see the Dhamma of one beyond training, not having known and seen it, he does not enter and dwell in it, not having touched it with his body, how can you say that there is knowledge of one beyond training in one who is still in training?”
“Is it that there is knowledge of one beyond training in one who is still in training?”

original: Asekhassa asekhaṁ ñāṇaṁ atthi, asekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāti passati, diṭṭhaṁ viditaṁ sacchikataṁ upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: asekhassa asekham ñāṇam atthi asekhaḥ asekham dhammam jānāti passati diṭṭham viditam sacchikatam upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: Does the adept have knowledge of the adept? Does the adept know and see the adept’s Dhamma? Does he, having reached it and attained it, dwell in it? Does he touch it with his body?
“Yes.”

original: Sekhassa asekhaṁ ñāṇaṁ atthi, sekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ jānāti passati, diṭṭhaṁ viditaṁ sacchikataṁ upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: sekhassa asekham ñāṇam atthi sekhaḥ asekham dhammam jānāti passati diṭṭham viditam sacchikatam upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Does the one in training have knowledge of the adept? Does the one in training know and see the adept’s Dhamma? Does he, having reached it and attained it, dwell in it? Does he touch it with his body?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Sekhassa asekhaṁ ñāṇaṁ atthi, sekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ na jānāti na passati, adiṭṭhaṁ aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ na upasampajja viharati, na kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: sekhassa asekham ñāṇam atthi sekhaḥ asekham dhammam na jānāti na passati adiṭṭham aviditam a sacchikatam na upasampajja viharati na kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Does the adept have knowledge of the one in training? Does the adept know and see the one in training’s Dhamma? Does he, having reached it and attained it, dwell in it? Does he touch it with his body?”
“Yes.”

original: Asekhassa asekhaṁ ñāṇaṁ atthi, asekho asekhaṁ dhammaṁ na jānāti na passati, adiṭṭhaṁ aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ na upasampajja viharati, na kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: asekhassa asekham ñāṇam atthi asekhaḥ asekham dhammam na jānāti na passati adiṭṭham aviditam a sacchikatam na upasampajja viharati na kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Does the one in training have knowledge of the one in training? Does the one in training know and see the one in training’s Dhamma? Does he, having reached it and attained it, dwell in it? Does he touch it with his body?”
“That can’t be said.”
Does a trainee have knowledge of one beyond training?
“Yes.”

analyzed: gotrabhuno puggalassa sotāpatti magge ñāṇaṃ atthi iti
translated: Does a person of inconstant temperament have knowledge of the path of stream-entry?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa sotāpattiphale ñāṇaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa sotāpatti phale ñāṇam atthi iti
translated: Does a person who is practicing for realization of the fruit of stream-entry have knowledge of the fruit of stream-entry?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: sakadāgāmiphala … anāgāmiphala … arahattasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa arahatte ñāṇaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala anāgāmi phala arahatta sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa arahatte ñāṇaṃ atthi iti
translated: Does a person who is practicing for realization of the fruit of once-returning … for realization of the fruit of non-returning … for realization of perfection have knowledge of perfection?🔽“No.”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  na vattabba
translated: You shouldn’t say that.
“Does a trainee have knowledge of one beyond training?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu āyasmā ānando sekho—“bhagavā uḷāro”ti jānāti, “sāriputto thero, mahāmoggallāno thero uḷāro”ti jānātīti?
analyzed: nanu āyasmai ānandaḥ sekhaḥ bhagavā uḷāraḥ iti jānāti sāriputto theraḥ mahāmoggallānaḥ theraḥ uḷāraḥ iti jānāti iti
translated: “But, Ānanda, doesn’t the trainee Ānanda know that the Buddha is outstanding, that the senior disciples Sāriputta and Mahāmoggallāna are outstanding?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci āyasmā ānando sekho—“bhagavā uḷāro”ti jānāti, “sāriputto thero, mahāmoggallāno thero uḷāro”ti jānāti, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci āyasmai ānandaḥ sekhaḥ bhagavā uḷāraḥ iti jānāti sāriputto theraḥ mahāmoggallānaḥ theraḥ uḷāraḥ iti jānāti tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Well then, you should say that a trainee has knowledge of one beyond training.”
Discussion of the knowledge of one beyond training is finished.
